title: Opinions on one trick ponies.
body:
So as of late ive been finding that i can consistently carry games with kayle, and chances are ill be able to break out of bronze with her this coming season.

But im a bit iffy about relying on my skills with one champ to climb elo, it almost feels like cheating but at the same time ive heard of plenty of one trick ponies making it to diamond and up so just wanted your opinions on the playstyle.

replies.body: I am kayle one trick pony Wurf, but I find its sometimes harder to play solo que then duo with her because alot of low elo people dont know what her alt does or dont think you will use it on them so they run away with it on them andwaste it. Haveing a duo partner helps to fix this problem abit.

Generally speaking it's better to one trick pony to climb, and then learn the rest when your higher.

The key is actually learning the other roles once your higher up.

i can actually kinda understand where you are coming from here.

Its much easier to learn from your mistakes than your successes.

Ive played with gold elo players before (nothing fancy i know) and i learned so much more from being trashed and trying to adapt and recover from that than i ever did from snowballing in bronze.

Yeah basically the thing is, your going to make hundreds of mistakes in a game as a bronzie, but no one in your games is going to punish you for these mistakes, get into a Plat Elo game, and you will start being punished for most of your mistakes no matter where you play.

This enables you to actually see what your mistakes are, rather then not see them because you never get punished.

Go for it man! Kayle is a super strong Solo q pick! Good for just about any comp and good against almost any comp. Can win most matchups, has a strong laning phase and just brings so much to a team. She is just about of one the only champs who you can probably do well with in EVERY role.

As long as its a champ that isn't frequently picked/banned then go for it (and especially if you can play more than one role with the champ).

Things to be aware of though:
-If you can only play one champ/playstyle/lane then your team will do worse than average since youre forcing them onto their bad roles more often and you'll be more likely to end up with a bad teamcomp. You need to play better to achieve the same winrate as someone more flexible.
-If your champ gets nerfed, or buffed to much and becomes high priority pick/ban, you will be heavily affected, especially if you rely on champion specific skills or cheese strats to get advantages.
I do have some backup champs like akali, trynda, singed, lucian, ashe, shyvana etc but kayle is just my best all around for pure stats, kda winrate cs per minute etc etc.

If it's low elo and not a champs that's banned most every game, I say go for it. It's not like you'd come across many games where you wouldn't be able to use your preferred champ. Just make you you can use them in 2-3 positions and you should be fine until you reach high gold or plat, it's around that point you'd want to start using more than the one champ. I mean sure there's people who've reached diamond+ with just one champ but it's no good to rely on a single champ at that high an MMR, people are a lot less forgiving about that in high elo.
ur filthy! quinn is a beast.

i can play kayle in all 5 positions :3

Won a game where i went adc a couple games ago, got pretty fed. that and i mostly play her top because she shits on all these juggernauts.

there's nothing really wrong with them. like unless the player plans on going pro, they don't really have a need to thoroughly learn more than 1 champion.
also, for most champs, knowledge about how to play the game and not the champ itself should be more than enough to not feed with them.
learn at least 2. if 1 gets banned u are screwed
